title: Cascaded and Parallel DBD Reactor with Spike Electrode Configuration for Enhanced DeNOx from Diesel Engine Exhaust
publication: International Journal of Plasma Environmental Science and Technology
abstract: This paper proposes cascaded and parallel DBD reactor modules designed for real time treatment of high flow rate diesel engine exhaust.

title: Spike Electrode Based DBD Reactor for Improved Electric Discharge Power Toward Better Diesel Engine Exhaust Treatment at Low Applied Voltage
abstract: This paper presents a detailed study on achieving higher NOx removal at lower applied voltage. Electric field simulations were carried out using COMSOL Multiphysics followed by experimental validation.

title: Enhancement of NOx Removal Efficiency from Real Diesel Engine Exhaust Using Cascaded Voltage Efficient DBD Reactor and Adsorbent Reactor
abstract: This work presents a proof of concept for enhanced NOx removal by integrating non thermal plasma with adsorption based exhaust treatment.

title: Experimental Comparison of High Voltage Pulse and AC Excited DBD Reactor Configurations for Diesel Exhaust Treatment
publication: IEEE Global Conference for Advancement in Technology (GCAT)
abstract: This paper experimentally compares HVAC and high voltage pulsed excitation modes for NOx removal from diesel engine exhaust.

title: NOx Treatment from Diesel Engine Exhaust Using Cascaded Electric Discharge Based Non Thermal Plasma and Continuous Adsorption Desorption
abstract: This study investigates long term plasma and adsorbent exposure to exhaust pollutants and proposes a recyclable adsorption desorption cycle for sustained operation.

title: Efficient Electrode Configuration for NOx Treatment from Diesel Engine Exhaust at Low Applied Voltage
publication: Emission Control Science and Technology Springer
abstract: This paper addresses plasma reactor design constraints and demonstrates their resolution using electric field based numerical simulations.

title: Diesel Engine Emissions Mitigation Using Cascaded NTP Reactor and Continuous Plasma Activated Adsorption Desorption
publication: Water Air and Soil Pollution Springer
abstract: This work analyzes reactor performance degradation during long term operation and demonstrates performance recovery using plasma catalysis.
